## Overview of areas

::: {.grid}

::: {.g-col-6}
### Objectives

The foundations that guide how the lab is managed: shared objectives, responsibilities, standard operating principles (SOPs), recurring agendas, and planning and review practices.
:::

::: {.g-col-6}
### Communication

How we communicate internally and externally: email practices, website content, interaction with the faculty, public-facing communication, and media-related materials.
:::

::: {.g-col-6}
### Infrastructure

Operational foundations that keep the lab running: internal handbooks, repositories, digital systems, controlling and administration, shared resources, and archiving.
:::

::: {.g-col-6}
### Support

Administrative and coordination support for core activities: structures and processes that enable teaching and research, including coordination with institutional services.
:::

::: {.g-col-6}
### Risk Management

Processes and responsibilities that ensure compliance, security, and preparedness for critical situations affecting people, data, or operations.
:::

::: {.g-col-6}
### Procurement

How we obtain the equipment, services, and materials required for our activities, including ordering processes and reimbursement procedures.
:::

::: {.g-col-6}
### HR

People-related processes across the full lifecycle of appointments: hiring, onboarding, travel arrangements, leave management, and offboarding.
:::

:::
